result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Minutes.

The witness subpoenaed for 22CF130 had to respond to an emergency and therefore is no longer available for the preliminary hearing today.  The parties would be prepared to proceed with the preliminary hearing in 22CF120 today.   State will revoke its offer if defendant proceeds to preliminary hearing.
Court clarifies if the revocation is of a global offer regarding all 5 cases before the Court today.  State clarifies that the offer revoked would include 22CF120, 22CF130, and 22CF80.  
The defendant understands that by proceeding with the preliminary hearing, that the offers in those cases will be revoked.
Court resets all cases to 05-17-2022 at 3:00pm so that all witnesses can be available and the cases can all stay at the same point.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony bail jumping and knowingly violate domestic abuse order.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-21-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the condition that he have no contact with K.J.A., DOB: 05-24-1978.    Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
